alert.note: Alert for Lafayette; Upper St. Martin (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 6:23PM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Lafayette and west central St. Martin Parishes through 700 PM CDT... At 623 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Broussard, or near St. Martinville, moving northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lafayette, Scott, Breaux Bridge, Carencro, Arnaudville and Broussard. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 99 and 111. Interstate 49 between mile markers 1 and 6. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
